title: PBE
body: So im really into testing new champions and looking to testing new stuff.I created my pbe account a year ago and still didnt recieve an email:(.Do i need to be somewhat "popular" to access pbe or do i like need high elo.I was just wondering if there were any restrictions for me to not recieve my pbe email{{champion:32}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
The criteria for how PBE testers are chosen is dynamic and changes quite a lot. It's true that we look for people who have a history of positive behavior on the rift, and those who will give us some great feedback! Sometimes we will send out a batch of invites to players who are heavy players of something we're looking to test. For example, if we were looking to rework Taric, we'd look for those who play a ton of Taric and look fabulous while doing so. :P

You can find our complete FAQ on the PBE [here.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751904-Public-Beta-Environment-FAQ#top) Let me know if you have any questions.

Riot looks at your history of bans, restrictions, or leaver busters, They look for people that have a good attitude and are willing to help so if you have a clean background they probably just aren't accepting that many new people and they also look for people who are in the meta such as a new feature that has to do with junglers they will let high level junglers test out the new feature. Other than that I don't know what to tell you.
You could try sending a again beacuse the people they pick for pbe is mostly random
